Dining Notes: North Beach Fish Camp opens in Neptune Beach News Sports Entertainment Lifestyle Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals LOCAL Dining Notes: North Beach Fish Camp opens in Neptune Beach Gary T. Mills It's been a busy summer at the Beaches, as mentioned in this column a couple of weeks ago in our semiannual look at Jacksonville restaurant openings and closings. Today, we'll take a closer look at a couple of those. Open a month at Beaches Town Center, North Beach Fish Camp debuted its second-floor bar and dining area last weekend, offering diners first come-first served seating - and a view. Downstairs, the restaurant offers a contemporary take on beach casual, with hardwood floors, bright white booths and floor-to-ceiling windows offering views of busy First Street, thanks to an extensive remodel from the colorful, tropical flair of Caribbee Key Island Grill . North Beach Fish Camp is the latest restaurant from Lisa and Ben Groshell , the chef/owner of Beaches fine-dining mainstay Marker 32 and 3-year-old Palm Valley Fish Camp in Ponte Vedra Beach. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. North Beach and Palm Valley are sister restaurants, sharing a similar logo, atmosphere and menu. Among the selections on the menu are: Appetizers: Raw Select Oysters on the Half Shell ($7, ½ dozen; $12, dozen); New England Steamer Clams with Drawn Butter ($14); Peel & Eat May port Shrimp Cocktail ($9); Grilled Octopus & White Bean Salad ($9) Entrees: Mayport Shrimp & Creamy Grits ($18); Blue Crab Cakes with Caper Aioli & Side ($18); and Scallops & Andouille Sausage with Tomato, White Beans & Spinach ($23). There's also Low Boil Shrimp, Clams, Crawfish and Andouille for Two ($36); Buttermilk Pan Fried Chicken Breast with Grits, Collard Greens & Tasso Gravy ($14); and Top Sirloin Steak with Brandy Pepper Corn Demi served with Mixed Greens & Fries ($16). Fried Dinner Platters: Clam Strips ($14), Shrimp ($16), Fish Filet ($14), Oysters ($16), Scallops ($17), Deviled Crab (2 for $12). Located in Neptune Beach at 100 First St., North Beach Fish Camp is open 4 to 10 p.m. on Mondays and Tuesdays; and 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. Wednesday through Sunday. Urban Flats open in Jacksonville Beach In Jacksonville Beach, Urban Flats Flatbread & Wine Co. opened in mid-July after a lengthy stop-and-start build-out. The restaurant, at 131 First St. N. next to Campeche Bay , is the third Northeast Florida location and fifth for the Central Florida-based chain, according to the company's website. A large oval bar, with seating for 30, is the restaurant's focal point among the mix of booths and tables. But it's the large, outdoor covered patio that is sure to be a fan favorite. Separated from the bar by two large glass garage doors, the patio offers plenty of lounge seating cooled by overhead fans, an ideal setting for sipping wine and catching up with friends as the sun sets. A sample of the offerings from Urban Flats' menu: Gourmet flatbreads range from the Classic (basil pesto, roma tomatoes and mozzarella; $8.50) to Fig and Prosciutto ($9) to Chicken Caesar ($11), Turkey, Pear and Brie ($9.75) among the 18 varieties offered. Starters include Lobster Mac and Cheese ($9.25), Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes ($11.25), Loaded Potato Dip ($8.75) and others. Among the main courses are Chipotle Rubbed Bistro Steak ($12.75), Cedar-Planked Salmon ($12.75), Baja Fish Tacos ($10.75), Seasonal Ravioli ($12), Santa Fe Baby Back Ribs ($14). For lighter fare, look for a half-dozen salads ($7.50 to $9.75) and sandwiches, including Housemade Meatball ($10.25), Urban Chicken Salad ($8.25) and Artichoke, Wild Mushroom and Goat Cheese Flatwich ($9.25). More than 75 wines are featured on the well-organized menu, allowing novice drinkers and wine aficionados to quickly narrow their seach. Cocktails and beer are also offered. Urban Flats is open daily at 11 a.m. Underbelly adds lunch to downtown options Underbelly is one of downtown Jacksonville's newest lunch spots. The bar and live music venue that opened in early June at 113 E. Bay St. added a limited lunch menu this month, featuring: 18-Hour Pulled Pork Sliders: Two sliders served with chips ($6), baked beans ($7) or side salad ($8). Wood-Fired Flatbreads: Cheese ($5), Tomato/Basil/Goat Cheese ($7), Prosciutto/Garlic/Goat Cheese ($7), Pulled Pork ($8) or vegan-friendly Tomato/Basil /Garlic/Tempeh ($6) Owners Emily Moody and Cameron Beard have transformed the former Ivy Bar into a rustic, relaxed space for lunch and a popular live entertainment spot at night, hosting bands, comedians, jam sessions and more. Grab lunch at one of a handful of tables or at the bar, which features 32 beers on tap, including a selection from Jacksonville's Intuition Ale Works . Underbelly opens at 11 a.m. weekdays for lunch. More in the works With building permits issued in the last week, work has begun on a couple of noteworthy projects previously reported in this column, including: The Salty Fig: After launching their Salty Fig food truck earlier this summer , brothers Jeff and John Stanford are making progress on their southern gastropub at 901 King St., across from Kickbacks Gastrobup in the busy King Street District. The Loop Pizza Grill : A month after announcing its plans to build and open a new prototype restaurant , 31-year-old Jacksonville-based The Loop has begun work on the project at the St. Johns Town Center, next to Total Wine & More, at 4413 Town Center Parkway. Firehouse Subs: The Jacksonville-based sub sandwich chain will open a restaurant at 13470 Beach Blvd., near the recently opened First Watch . And the Shiny Spoon goes to ... After a summer-long drought, the "Shiny Spoon" award is back, thanks to a couple of food vendors at the Jacksonville Zoo and Gardens. Each week, the Florida Department of Business and Professional Regulation's Division of Hotels and Restaurants releases a list of restaurants, caterers and mobile food vendors that have received zero safety or sanitation violations during inspections within the last 12 months. Following inspections last week, the following have achieved that honor and are awarded a Shiny Spoon: Main Camp Café (non-seating), 370 Zoo Parkway. (three inspections, dating to Nov. 15, 2011) Sno Biz International (mobile food vendor), 370 Zoo Parkway. (three inspections, dating to June 6, 2011) Congratulations. gary.mills@jacksonville.com (904) 359-4422 twitter.com/garytmills facebook.com/jaxdiningnews Careers Staff Directory Accessibility Sitemap Legals Public notice certification Our Ethical Principles USA TODAY Network Style Guide Responsible Disclosure Subscription Terms & Conditions Advertiser Acceptance Policy Terms of Service Privacy Policy California Notice at Collection Your Privacy Choices Contact Us Support Local Business Advertise Your Business Promote your Event Buy and Sell Licensing & Reprints Legal Notices Help Center Subscriber Guide Manage Account Give Feedback Subscribe Today Newsletters Facebook X Instagram eNewspaper NIE Jobs Real Estate Classifieds Pay Your Ad Bill Shopping 10BEST LocaliQ Digital Marketing Solutions © 2025 www.jacksonville.com.
